message: Bob, I'm pleased to offer you my product for $1,200,000. This is a fair price considering the value it brings. I'm confident it will be a valuable asset to you. Let me know your thoughts.

I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the market value of the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to stay within my budget. What do you think?

Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer. While I understand your budget constraints, $900,000 simply doesn't reflect the true value of this product. I'm willing to come down to $1,000,000.  This price is still within your stated value, and it allows me to achieve a more reasonable return on my investment. Let's meet halfway and seal the deal.

I understand your perspective, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I can only go up to $950,000. This is the highest I can stretch within my budget. What do you think?
